parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.75</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of type names of all vehicle's magazines.

When applied to a unit (soldier), the command behaves differently and will omit magazines already loaded into unit's weapons. Use [[currentMagazine]] to get this information for a currently loaded magazine. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''magazines''' vehicle</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name> p1 </name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name> s2</name>=<value> [[magazines]] [vehicle, includeEmpty] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(Since Arma 3 v1.99.146475)</value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> [vehicle, includeEmpty]: [[Array]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle.  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> includeEmpty (Optional): [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to include empty magazines. Default: [[false]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name> r2</name>=<value>[[Array]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mags <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> magazines [[player]]</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[currentMagazine]], [[magazinesTurret]], [[magazinesDetail]], [[magazinesAmmo]], [[magazinesAmmoFull]], [[ammo]], [[weapons]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]
<dd class="note">
In '''OFP v1.96''', if a weapon is loaded with an empty magazine, that magazine will still be counted by this command. The [[ammo|ammo]] command can be used to check if a unit has any ammunition into it is last magazine.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 25 November 2011
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Dr_Eyeball|Dr_Eyeball]]'''
<dd class="note">
This command does not include non-turret weapon magazines, such as smoke, flare or chaff magazines which are usually declared in the root of the vehicle's class, rather than in the Turrets hierarchy.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
